meta.description: Structural and functional data of eukaryotic cell organelles.

organelles.name: Nucleus
organelles.function: Stores genetic material (DNA) and coordinates cell activities like growth and reproduction.

organelles.name: Mitochondria
organelles.function: Generates most of the cell's supply of adenosine triphosphate (ATP), used as a source of chemical energy.
organelles.notes: Often referred to as the powerhouse of the cell.

organelles.name: Ribosome
organelles.function: Site of protein synthesis. Reads messenger RNA (mRNA) sequence and translates it into genetic code.

organelles.name: Chloroplast
organelles.function: Conducts photosynthesis by capturing light energy to convert carbon dioxide and water into glucose.

organelles.name: Cell Membrane
organelles.function: Semi-permeable membrane that separates the interior of the cell from the outside environment.

organelles.name: Lysosome
organelles.function: Contains digestive enzymes to break down waste materials and cellular debris.
